fields.description:
Hi, I migrate JIRA today.
And because of performance problem, I inspected cache issue parameter...

Then, is it normal that Cache issues is turned to off in JIRA and there's a warning when we want to deploy JIRA in websphere :
"Warning
Please ensure that WebSphere's "Servlet Caching" is turned off. Otherwise JIRA will die with ClassCastExceptions."
fields.summary: Cache issues to OFF in JIRA AND WAS5.1

fields.description:
Hi,
When I see the SystemOut.log, there is this exception :

[1/24/06 18:08:50:918 CET] 5f4bed3f ServletValueS E webwork.util.ServletValueStack  METHOD: "fieldType", exception: 
[1/24/06 18:08:50:965 CET] 5f4bed3f ServletValueS E webwork.util.ServletValueStack  TRAS0014I: The following exception was logged com.atlassian.configurable.ObjectConfigurationException: Field with key: description does not exist.


I will attach a file with more information.
fields.summary: METHOD: "fieldType", exception ..... Field with key: description does not exist.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9142].
  {panel}


The custom renderer api looks great. We have several fields we would like to customise.

However the time/effort overhead for creating custom renderers is large. For all of our custom
fields (and I'd imagine most peoples needs), a simple regex substitution would be perfect.

This renderer would contain a list of regex, substituion pairs and would call replaceAll for
each pair in order.
fields.summary: Regular expression renderer

fields.description: I was able to enter 31-apr-2006 (which was interpreted as 1-may-2006)
fields.summary: Able to enter invalid date in Due Date field (Create new issue)
Allow an admin user to turn on/off Jelly support in the Administation section

fields.description:
in the jira docs: http://atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/csv_import.html#importconfigwizard

it says:
"The next step of the import process is to run the import configuration wizard to determine how the CSV data can be mapped to JIRA fields. The CSV importer is available from Administration -> Import &  Export -> External System Import."

but the path to the import configuration wizard is not complete. it should be:
"Administration -> Import &  Export -> External System Import -> Comma-separated values (CSV) -> CSV Import Wizard"
fields.summary: update jira doc section: Importing Data From CSV
Running Jira with Frontbase

fields.description: The Mantis importer searches for 'bug links', ie text containing 'bug #123' or '#123', and converts these to JIRA links (eg. JRA-123). There is a bug in the algorithm used here, which causes legitimate non-link #'s to be stripped from text.
fields.summary: Mantis importer mangles words containing # which aren't bug links

fields.description:
In the Add New Context screen for custom fields a javascript error occurs when you try and select a project. In IE this means that you are no longer able to create a context for a project. Firefox appears to ignore the error.

The error:
document.getElementById(...) is null or not an object
fields.summary: JavaScript error on "Add New Context"
Delete Custom Field Context

fields.description:
We have a strange problem that make us imposible to add new projects.

I go to Administration -> Add Project.

I fill all the required data, I assign an user as the project lead.
And I add the project.

The first thing that I see new is a warning in red saying: Default Assignee: Project Lead (WARNING: User not Assignable.)

Well, that doesn't matter.

But, if now I press Browse Project, then I get the Oops.
I try another thing, I go to the home, and the project is not there, I can see all projects, except the new one. If I try to add a new jira issue, I look for the new project in the combobox and it's not there again. I can always see the project in the Administration link, but only there.

Use Case:
# Change indexing language to *Other*

# Search for text in Issue Navigator
# No results are returned
fields.summary: Cannot search for Korean Text

fields.description:
When importing from CSV, the import successfully created users, components etc but when it attempted to create issues a Null Pointer Exception was produced, from ExternalUtils.addOption().

It turns out it was to do with a custom field only being applicable to certain types of Issues, and our data contained a value for that custom field in an issue of the wrong type.

It would be good if there was a more informative error message than just a Null Pointer Exception when this occurs.
fields.summary: Importing from CSV failed with poor error message

fields.description:
With more users creating custom workflows, the notifications should be more flexible. 

At the moment Jira ignores status when printing the change list. This is because it assumes the user has created a custom notification events, and so does not need to see the status change. This isn't done often with most users opting to use the Issue Updated Event. So it should be possible to edit the event to show the status change (currently it is hardcoded into Jira).
fields.summary: Add option NOT to ignore status changes in email

fields.description:
Add a list of custom plugins, services and listeners installed in a instance on the system info page and the support email.

Will become more important as people start writing their own plugins and customising code.

Will need to differentiate between system plugins and custom plugins.
fields.summary: Add custom plugins/listeners/services installed on a system in the system info page and support email

fields.description:
Create a page that outlines Jira concepts and common tasks that can be performed in Jira.  Would also be our best list of features in Jira.

Analogy: 1st chapter in a tech book.

It would contain links to other doc pages in a _story book_ manner. E.g.
{quote}You can also specify what [issue types|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/manageIssueTypeScheme.html] you want for each project{quote}

Target audience: Sales, new admins, new users
fields.summary: Create Documentation Overview

fields.description:
We use groups extensively and there are a few little UI improvements that could make the feature so much more useful.

1. MAKE UI FOR SPECIFYING GROUPS LIKE SPECIFYING USERS - PROVIDE PICK-LIST POPUP: When you choose the "Specify User" drop-down box option in search, an "people" icon lights up that you can click on to get a pick-list of users to choose from. I'd like the same for whenever one has to "Specify Group". I'd like this for both SEARCH and for any other forms where one has to pick a group. UI should totally match the one provided for user acct selection.

2. ENABLE ABILITY TO RENAME AN EXISTING GROUP: JIRA does not have the ability to rename groups. As organizations evolve, dept names tend to change or merge. It's tough to keep track of old names and would be nice to rename. Right now we basically create a new group and manually re-add users to it before deleting the old group. That's annoying.
fields.summary: Group Browsing & Admin: <1> Add a new  "group picker" popup (like the one for user acct picker) on all forms (search, issue create/edit, etc) and <2> Enable admins to rename an existing group

fields.description: It is impossible to search for issues which don't have due dates assigned. If no value is given "Due Before" and "Due after" then any issue is returned independent if has  a due date assigned or not.
fields.summary: Ability to search for issues with no due date associated

fields.description: It would be nice if one could filter based on "All project in category X".  The reason is that you only allow searches on fields that are common to all projects.  So, it is not possible to search on a custom field that only exists in projects of type A and not type B unless you manually select all of the projects yourself.  Since the project themselves change, this makes the saved filter obsolete in short order.
fields.summary: Improvement to Filters:  Filter by project category

fields.summary: NPE in Velocity ResourceManager

fields.description:
It seems that when moving an issue:
 - The issue has a security level
 - The destination project requires the Fix For version to be set

Then JIRA gets stuck on step 3 of the move issue wizard, where field values are mapped. Nothing is shown except a 'Next' button. When clicked, this prints a validation error:

"Fix Version/s" field is required and you do not have permission to Resolve Issues for project "<Destination project>".

Evidently there ought to be a 'Fix Version' field on this page, but it is being hidden for some reason by the presence of a security level.

To reproduce:

# Create two projects (SRC and DEST).
# Create a security scheme with at least one level, and set that level to 'default'. The actual groups in the level doesn't matter.
# Associate the security scheme with SRC
# Create a field configuration and make Fix For required. Make a field conf scheme and sssociate this with DEST
# Create an issue in SRC, and try to move it to DEST
fields.summary: Cannot move issue: "Fix Version/s" field is required and you do not have permission to Resolve Issues

Please sir, can we have a servlet plugin for JIRA like Confluence has? They get all the cool toys. It's no fair!

*throws old toys out of cot demanding new ones*
fields.summary: Servlet plugin!

fields.description:
Security levels allow JIRA issue visibility to be altered per issue, instead of just per project (as with permission schemes). However, currently security levels can only be set by hand (although a default may apply).

It would be great if we could provide a flexible workflow post-function, which set the security level of an issue based on various configurable criteria. For instance:
 - The reporter's group (JRA-5276).
 - The issue type (JRA-4794).
 - The issue's component (JRA-3838).
fields.summary: Create post-function to set security level

fields.description:
Changing a workflow that is currently being used is a tremendously tedious task because you can only change project workflow schemes one at a time (JIRA-5254) and you cannot change a workflow or a scheme if any product is associated with it. 

As my company adapts JIRA workflows for our own processes, the workflow edit process is prohibitive. This is what I must do (as I understand it) to make a modification to an existing workflow:

Background: Assume that we want to change workflow W in scheme WS. WS contains other workflows that aren't being changed. And there are at least two projects that use scheme WS.

1. Make a copy of workflow W. Call it W2
2. Make a copy of workflow scheme WS. Call it WS2
3. Remove references to workflow W from scheme WS2
4. Add references to workflow W2 to scheme WS2
5. Go to each project individually and change the workflow scheme to WS2 (see JIRA-5254)
6. Make the appropriate changes to workflow W
7. Go to each project individually and change the workflow scheme back to WS
8. Remove all workflow references in scheme WS2 prior to deleting it.
9. Delete scheme WS2
10. Delete workflow W2

Making all these backup schemes and workflows is necessary because we have added workflow states and they won't be translated correctly unless we create copies.

And then I better hope I built my workflow correctly, because if I made a mistake, I have to go through the entire process again to make even the smallest change.

Requested changes:
1. Bulk project workflow scheme changes (JIRA-5254)
2. Ability to change an active workflow. That way, I could leave my workflow scheme unchanged and not have to create any copies.
fields.summary: Remove tedium from changing workflows

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
    * Perform a query using Find Issues that returns multiple pages of issues
    * Click either of the Excel export links
    * Choose any option when it comes to the actual file (Open, Save, Cancel)
    * Attempt to navigate to another page in the list of issues

Observed Behavior:  JIRA paging bug.  All issues end up being shown on one web page and the paging feature disappears.

Expected Behavior:  The pages of issues remain even after exporting the data to excel.
fields.summary: Export to excel messes up paging

fields.description: HTML is not escaped for the contents of failed macros and bad links. For normal JIRA usage this means that the Wiki Rendered fields may produce unexpected results for html special characters (<, & etc) in the event of a macro typo or malformed url. If you enter in the description from JRA-6372 (included below) it blows up the viewing of the issue. It is treating the Velocity stuff as unknown macros. {noformat} I've exhausted all efforts thru the user forum. Maybe someone can help me? I want to include values of custom fields in my email notifiactions. I was successful (at first) by using some code from another user: #foreach ($cfv in ${issue.getRelated("ChildCustomFieldValue")}) #set ($cf = ${cfv.getRelatedOne("ParentCustomField")}) #if (${cfv.getString("stringvalue")}) ${cf.getString("name")}:${cfv.getString("stringvalue")} #elseif (${cfv.getString("textvalue")}) ${cf.getString("name")}:${cfv.getString("textvalue")} #elseif (${cfv.getString("numbervalue")}) ${cf.getString("name")}:${cfv.getLong("numbervalue")} #end #end Well, that seemed to work, but then I found that NOT ALL custom fields were handled by the above code. Specifically, drop down values. However, it didn't bother me so much that for some custom fields the values displayed as internal codes. The problem was one project that had a custom field of type 'project picker'. email notifications for that project caused the template to break with an error: Invocation of method 'getLong' in class org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericValue threw exception class java.lang.ClassCastException : java.lang.Double at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:246) at ... etc. ... I tried putting in #else code to handle some cases, I tried putting in code I found from Anton in the user forum: #elseif ($cf.getLong("fieldtype").intValue() == 1 || $cf.getLong("fieldtype").intValue() == 3 || $cf.getLong("fieldtype").intValue() == 5) ${cf.getString("name")} : ${cfv.getString("stringvalue")} #elseif ($cf.getLong("fieldtype").intValue() == 2) ${cf.getString("name")} : ${cfv.getLong("numbervalue")} #elseif ($cf.getLong("fieldtype").intValue() == 4) ${cf.getString("name")} : ${cfv.getDate("datevalue")} all to no avail. I really would like to get this working - or at least not broken. I've looked at the Velocity user's manual and scoured the source code, but I can't find how to do this. As a side note (I can log an issue if you like), I noticed that when viewing an issue that has been moved between projects, the "Change History" also shows the internal project ID rather than the project name, so even within the web interface, it looks like internal ID's still show up sometimes. {noformat}
fields.summary: Wiki Renderer does not HTML encode contents of unknown macros

fields.description:
A popular feature request is that JIRA should be able to require a field only on a specific transition (JRA-5783). Currently field required'ness is determined by field configurations which are scoped by project/issue type.

An often suggested workaround is to create a validator which checks if a field is empty, and complains if so.  There is even user-contributed code that does the job at:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/Workflow+Validator+to+require+a+field+on+a+transition+screen

Since it's so useful, we should package this properly as a plugin and distribute it with JIRA, as an 80% interim solution.
fields.summary: Create a workflow validator to require a field on workflow transition

I'm trying to import a CSV file with due date as one of the fields, but it doesn't want to populate.  I've defined the date format, but it still doesn't populate, whereas all the other fields populate without a problem.  I'll attach my file and I'm wondering if you can help me figure out what's going wrong.

Thanks for your help.

2. Open Components / Versions for Fitting Software

fields.description:
Until today when JIRA sends a notification to a user it is in the following format:
----------------------------------------------------------------
         Key: WLBXSR-397
         URL: browse/WLBXSR-397
     Project: WLBX Service Requests
        Type: Change Request

    Reporter: Cindy Ann Honess
 Assigned to: Ian Albuquerque 
 Attachments: DOC035.PDF
-----------------------------------------------------------------
However recently there has been a need for a custom field called 'Severity' to be included in the email notification as well:
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Key: WLBXSR-397
         URL: browse/WLBXSR-397
     Project: WLBX Service Requests
        Type: Change Request

    Reporter: Cindy Ann Honess
 Assigned to: Ian Albuquerque 
 Attachments: DOC035.PDF
Severity 3-Medium
-----------------------------------------------------------------
How do I do it?
fields.summary: Customizing the email notification that is sent by JIRA

fields.summary: External link in issue comment has broken external link image

fields.summary: No operations available for workflows
Cannot specify "NULL" in multiselect searcher custom field
Negative user / group filter

fields.description:
The Filter Groups box used to limit the visibility of groups in the Groups Browser seems to be case sensitive.

Let's say you have groups

* My group
* my second group
* My third Group

Filtering for "group" shows you the first two groups but not the third while "my" shows only the second group. Obviously this means that in Jira installations with mixed case group names, administrators can't really use the filtering as it's not reliable.
fields.summary: Filter Groups in Administration / Group Browser is case sensitive

fields.description: Basically, we need to be able to  promote issues from a public tracker to a project tracker if they resolve to a bug.  The move capability allows us to shove them into the bug list, but we would like to leave the original issue  in the public tracker and indicate with a comment or status field that it has been promoted to a bug in the non-public system.  So, rather than Move, how about Copy, and for both, how about creating a comment automatically to indicate that the issue came from elsewhere to the new tracker?
fields.summary: Copy issue instead of move - leave old issue in place, generate new, create link automatically

fields.description: Jira doesn't seem to clean the temp directory. I have hundreds of files in jira/temp, named tempattach3600dat etc. Looking at the file dates, many of the files are several months old. This isn't very major for our installation but I guess this might be bad for installations where people attach a lot of large files.
fields.summary: Jira doesn't clean up $JIRA_HOME/jira/temp

fields.description:
A user must have one of the following permissions to display the "Bulk Change: " link on the issue navigator page:

EDIT_ISSUE, ASSIGN_ISSUE, DELETE_ISSUE

But when transitioning you do not necessarily need these permissions.
fields.summary: Permission problem with bulk operations

fields.description: The printable page returned when the "Print" icon is clicked while viewing a single issue contains a column on the left hand side that contains unimportant data. On a multipage printout you have a severe amount of unused space and the right hand side text is truncated in the pages printed (loss of data).
fields.summary: Modify Page Returned by Issue Print Icon (by logout) to be same as "Full Content"
Automaticaly watch an issue once you re-assign it

fields.description: I desperately would like the ability to filter by hours estimated and hours remaining. The most often requested use of this feature is a shared filter for "all my unestimated tasks in the current iteration."
fields.summary: Filter by hours estimated / hours remaining

fields.description:
We are currently doing our user Acceptance testing for new projects we are placing into our JIRA installation.  We are finding that When "logging work done" in an issue, the time estimate updates, but the comments are lost.  Work done comments are not captured and the work logged summary shows <no comment>

The users have access to Log work done and permission to add comments is also granted.  

Any advice you can give is appreciated.

thank.s.
fields.summary: Logging Work Done doesn't show work done comments.

fields.description:
I would really like the ability (for those that have the correct permissions) to enter a worklog time value when doing a workflow action like Resolve, Close, Reopen, etc.  Currently, we have the ability to add a comment before submitting those actions, so adding the worklog time field wouldn't be to hard (IMO).

Any ideas, objections?
fields.summary: Allow worklog submission on Resolve/Close/Reopen action

fields.description:
We need a portlet to display statistics like :
- workload for all users
- workload by user and by project
etc...
Currently, the "Two Dimensional Filter Statistics" portlet does not permit this...
fields.summary: portlet need - User workload statistics

fields.summary: Errors in logs: "Error occurred adding velocity params to template"

fields.description:
The *Workflow Based Permission* plugin does not work with JIRA 3.4.2 when importing data.

The following sequence of events causes a {{CyclicDependency}} exception within PicoContainer:

1. Install JIRA
2. Instal *Workflow Based Permission* plugin
3. Import XML data backup

A workaround is possible by following this sequence:

1. Install JIRA
2. Import XML data backup
3. Install *Workflow Based Permission* plugin
fields.summary: Workflow based permission plugin does not work with JIRA 3.4.2 when importing data

fields.description:
View issue screen with subtasks has erroneous HTML (maybe tags aren't closed properly). This *can* cause strange HTML redraw problems in picky browsers (e.g. the quick search bar was doing this in Opera for quite a while)


If you install the [HTML Validator extension|http://users.skynet.be/mgueury/mozilla/] in FireFox, you should see this
fields.summary: View issue screen with subtasks has erroneous HTML
Ability to assign an issue to a selected component's lead developer
Due date field cannot be set through RPC under non-English locale

fields.description: If one creates a link from issue A to issue B, and a user has permissions to see issue A, but not issue B then they won't see the link unless they look at the Change History. We like the security feature that doesn't let them see the link in the main view of the issue, however we need it to also be hidden in the Change History.
fields.summary: Change History shows links when main issue view doesn't
Would like to be able to retrieve an issue's Change History through API.

fields.description:
Independently of the locale, the calendar week shown e.g. when selecting a date always begins by sunday.
As we in germany (UK too, as far as I know) begin the calender week by monday, this year the calendar weeks are shifted.
Eg. today (16-Jan-2006) we have CW 3 with german (or UK) locale, but CW 2 with US locale.
As we very heavily use calendar weeks for our shippings, this is a real problem.
I tried changing the locale of the system user starting jira, the field "Default language" in the general configuration of jira,
and my own locale as a user in my user preferences, but no one of these 3 had any effects on the calendar week.
Is there a way in jira to change this?
fields.summary: Calendar week begins with sunday independently from locale

I've created filters such as "My Current Tasks" defined as "in [my project] for version [1.1] show me all issues assigned to [me]." I can't share that with everyone, only with the group(s) associated with [my project]... but that's more than one group. This would be a big hit with our teams.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9042].
  {panel}

Quick search by default creates a new filter with no project selected. My suggestion is to have it inherit the current context's project selection.

* So if I'm at the home page, it creates a non-project filter.
* If I'm in Issue Navigator then it uses whatever the current filter's project selection is.
* If I'm in a bug, then it uses that bug's project.

Perhaps control this with a little checkbox next to "Quick Search" called "Use current project"...? See the problem I have is that every time I use quick search I always have to go back and narrow the results. I understand that I can include the project's code in the search terms but that's just not as Quick. Plus it may be a pain if I've got an issue navigator open for multiple projects.
fields.summary: Quick Search - add checkbox for "in current project"..?

fields.description:
To help us identify which license key a customer is renewing or upgrading, we want to display a License ID (a unique identifier of sorts) on the admin View License page, which the customer can then quote when ordering their renewal.

The current thinking is that we'll use the first 10 characters of the license key as the License ID.
fields.summary: Add License ID to View License Page

fields.description:
At the moment when upgrade fails a lot of users simply point the old version of JIRA at the upgraded database. The actual problem is that most of the time this appears to work. The problem only surfaces when another upgrade is performed, this time properly - by exporting to and importing from to XML. As the export is performed using the 'old' version of JIRA, and hence using the 'old' entitymodel.xml file, records of the tables introduced in the the new version of JIRA are not exported.

When the export is imported, JIRA starts behaving 'badly' as some records that must be there are simply missing.

We need to trap any errors in the upgrade tasks and if one occurs put up a page that clearly reports the error and informs the user that they should fall back by importing the XML export into the old version of JIRA. We need to explicitly mention that simply pointing old version of JIRA at the upgraded database will cause problems!

If an autoexport was done by the upgrade, we also need to mention where it is located.

An alternative is to do the whole upgrade as one huge transaction. this way if something fails we can just roll back and the users can recover by just pointing the old JIRA at the database. The problem here is that some upgrade tasks have to manipulate a lot of data, and if the installation base is large the database can start running out of resources.
fields.summary: Improve error message if upgrade fails

When the export is imported, JIRA starts behaving 'badly' as some records that must be there are simply missing.

Need to do the same for all the protocols. I think the properties are different for pop3 and pop3s (and imap and imaps), so we need all of them.

fields.description:
When I move an issue, at one point the wizard says:

" Move Issue: Update Fields
Step 3 of 4: Update the fields of the issue to relate to the new project.

Note: Step 2 is not required. "

Why does it mention step 2 when I'm already on step 3?
fields.summary: When moving an issue, wizard gives odd information

fields.description:
I feel the priority field is confusing: its values express the idea of "criticality" of an issue, while "priority" should denote more the relative order that things should get done (i.e. the ones with more priority should get done first).

At this very moment, I have issues that seem very critical in the long term, being the "keys" to the success of my project, but due to the incertainties involved, I cannot assign them a high priority immediately.

In this sense, I believe it would be a better idea to rename the "Priority" field to "Criticality", and to create a new "Priority" field with values such as "Low, Medium, High, etc.". that really expresses the idea of priority.
fields.summary: Change "Priority" to "Criticality"; create a new "Priority" field

Duplicate cursor attributes in global-static.css and global-printable.css

fields.description:
We have reports that MySQL breaks in the above Ubuntu environment, when a page is accessed:

Cause:
com.opensymphony.module.propertyset.PropertyImplementationException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:OSPropertyEntry][propertyKey,webwork.i18n.encoding][type,5][id,10548][entityName,jira.properties][entityId,1] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO propertyentry (ID, ENTITY_NAME, ENTITY_ID, PROPERTY_KEY, propertytype) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Incorrect arguments to mysql_stmt_execute)


This appears to be an Ubuntu/Debian packaging problem:

http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=86294&highlight=mysql_stmt_execute

http://forums.mysql.com/read.php?39,49989,49989#msg-49989

A workaround is to use 'useServerPrepStmts=false' in your JDBC URL, eg:

{noformat}jdbc:mysql://localhost/jiradb?useServerPrepStmts=false{noformat}
fields.summary: JIRA breaks with latest Ubuntu updates for MySQL / glibc

fields.description:
The [SOAP RemoteIssue object|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/rpc-jira-plugin/latest/com/atlassian/jira/rpc/soap/beans/RemoteIssue.html#getAssignee()] has {{setAssignee(String)}} and {{getAssignee()}} methods. {{setAssignee()}} takes the username (eg. 'jsmith') but {{getAssignee}} returns the user's full name ("John Smith"), which is useless for anything except human consumption.

{{getAssignee()}} _ought_ to return a RemoteUser object, or failing that, the username (which could later be passed to {{getUser()}} to get the full name.
fields.summary: SOAP's RemoteIssue.getAssignee() does not return assignee username

Dave Meyer

Example:

Find Issues - Select all records with Planned Implementation Date (after) December 1, 2005

I expect to find records with Planned Implementation Date from December 2, 2005 and greater.  However I get records with Planned Implementation Date = December 1, 2005 and greater.
